shows.desc:
Fed up of hearing about what Muslim women were like from people who were neither Muslim nor female, Mariam Khan edited a book of essays, It’s Not About The Burqa, to bring together the voices of a variety of Muslim women – all angry at the lazy stereotyping – to tell their stories. She is joined by one of the key contributors, Yassmin Abdel-Magied.

Mariam Khan is a writer and activist on issues of feminism and Islam. Yassmin is a Sudanese-born author, broadcaster, social advocate and digital influencer. They will be in conversation with Chicago-based choreographer Amirah Sackett.

Supported by Amal – A Saïd Foundation Programme

shows.title: Love Embraces All (and other works)
shows.desc:
Through the poetry of the Sufi mystic Rumi, interpreted by Aja Black (The Reminders), and with sound design by Chicago DJ Nevin Hersch, Sackett’s new solo work explores the barriers we create within ourselves and the walls that others build around us. A heartfelt appeal to always choose love.
Age Recommendation: 8+
Duration: 60 mins

shows.title: Hip Hop Workshop
shows.desc:
Join Amirah in an exploration of physical movement in hip-hop culture. Learn more about hip-hop history and culture, as well as foundational movement styles of top-rocking, breaking, popping, and tutting. Come prepared to move in comfortable clothes and clean sneakers.
